intro: Fagara melanosticta, commonly known as the black-streaked evergreen, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves with prominent black veins, giving it its common name. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
